page.title: 12RELIGION:WENHAM AND RAYDON
page.content: The parish church in Raydon dedicated to St.Mary consists of a nave and chancel but no tower.It has recently had new doors donated by the U.S.Air Force.It is Church of England and the present rector is Reverend Herrington who combines this parish with Greatt Wenham. At present services are held alternately one Sunday at Great Wenham the following Sunday at Raydond at 11a.m.The church of St. Johns at Great Wenham has a nave, chancel and a er. The nave roof was retiled in 198484f but 16000 pounds is still needed for church restoration. A Salvation Army chapel still standing at Raydon was until recently a very thriving and well used building.Since the withdrawal and closure of the hall the Salvation Army who were especially well remembered for their Christmas carol visits now meet in Hadleigh.
